sen.e: A role called Shaku byoshi Drum which kept rhythm using Shaku was seen in the ancient gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), and as seen by the event that old Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment) had also the same kind of Ogi byoshi (fan rhythm), slapping at palm with a handheld instrument was used most widely and easily as an instrument to keep rhythm before the early-modern times in Japan.
